text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot Thai Kitchen so in the 
spirit of the upcoming 4th of July celebration

I thought I would share with you an American 
inspired Thai dish now this is kao pad american

or american fried rice so as a kid I always 
thought this dish was actually American food

and only as an adult that I realized wait a minute 
they don't have this dish in America but this dish

is very popular in Thailand especially amongst 
kids because it's not spicy and there's just lots

of fun components going on so let's get started so 
one of the main components of kao pad american is

fried chicken drumsticks cuz fried chicken is very 
American right now you can use whatever recipe for

fried chicken that you want you can even throw 
down some KFC on the plate if you don't want

to make it yourself but I'll just show you a very 
quick and simple fried chicken recipe if you want

to make it from scratch okay so I've got here 
some chicken drumsticks now quick marinade I've

got some fish sauce of course this is the Thai 
part and then just some soy sauce and this is Thai

soy sauce but you can use other kinds of soy sauce 
that you want just a little dash of white pepper

and I always like to keep a little bottle of white 
pepper when I'm too lazy to grind it fresh I'm

going to add now some water now this water it's 
going to help brine the chicken and make it a

little more juicy so I only need to marinate this 
for 30 minutes but halfway through I'm going to

come and flip this back over so that the chicken 
is evenly coated on each side and you can leave

it overnight if you want to get as much air out 
as possible and that's it while the chicken is

marinating let's take a look at the rest of our 
ingredients so I've got here some carrots and

carrots to us as a Western vegetable you can sort 
of tell whether a vegetables considered Western or

not based on whether we have a Thai name for it 
and entire carrot is a carrot it's limping and

I've also got some onion and I'm just gonna put 
them together because they're going in at the same

time and then of course some garlic we always 
stir-fry with garlic in Thailand second we're

going to look at our vegetables you can really put 
whatever kinds of vegetables you want but this is

sort of the classic so I've got some corn and then 
some sugar snap peas more commonly they use peas

like regular frozen peas you know the English 
peas but I don't really want to buy a whole bag

of frozen peas just to use a little bit in the 
fried rice and I don't like canned peas so I just

take sugar snap peas just make sure you remove the 
strings that run along the sides of the sugar snap

peas because that's really chew it you don't want 
to leave that in there I've also got some raisins

here now you might recall from my pineapple fried 
rice video that I mentioned that I don't like

raisins and savory food but for whatever reason 
it works in this dish and I don't mind it one

of the stars of the show is little hot dogs or 
wieners and obviously an American item so what

I've done with these is I just cut halfway up into 
four different sections and so like this when we

fry them the little sections are going to open up 
and they're gonna look like little octopus super

cute super Asian thing to do too so the sauce is 
very simple I've got here some ketchup with just

to us the epitome of the Western ingredient this 
year I've got soy sauce and golden mountain sauce

mixed together sorry I meant to separate them but 
I got carried away and I mix them by accident now

I'm going to mix the two together if you want 
to make it spicy you can substitute some of the

ketchup becomes sriracha that'll be really good 
too a little bit of white pepper to this just for

a little kick and that's it let's get cooking this 
is the order in which I suggest you do it then you

fry the chicken first because that's gonna take 
a little while so I'm adding some cornstarch in

order to sort of turn all that liquid into a thin 
batter and also some all-purpose flour a little

mix in the cornstarch is going to keep the batter 
crispier and lighter than if we were to just do

flour yeah that looks just about right I just want 
a thin coating I don't want thick KFC coating but

if that's what you want you can add a little more 
flour make it a little thicker and then you get a

thicker coating when you fry chicken I always 
want to make sure that my oil is deep enough

and I'm to heat it up to 350 once I dropped the 
chicken the temperature will drop and I'm going

to maintain it at 325 because the chicken is going 
to take quite a while so 8 minutes now is the time

you can go and fry up your egg so we're going to 
need a sunny-side up egg for this and I don't need

to show you how to cook them side up eggs I'm 
sure but this would be a good time to do it so

my chicken is nicely fried my eggs are fried now 
the last thing we're going to do before we cook

the rice is fry the wieners and turn them into the 
buses or octopi technically the oil have actually

turned off completely I'm just using residual heat 
from the chicken this does not need a lot of heat

and they will like magic turn into octopus in 
seconds be very nice and that's it since the

wieners are oh no go dude they are ah they're 
already cooked so you don't really need to cook

them you just need to heat them up and open them 
alright so I've got my wok here I'm going to add

a little bit of oil we're now onto our fried rice 
I'm gonna go in first with my bowl of aromatic so

onion garlic and carrots the he's not too high 
just on medium heat I want the onions to be

translucent and the carrots to start to soften up 
a little bit alright and now I'm going in with my

bowl of corn peas and raisins and if you give 
the raisins a chance to cook they'll actually

soften up and become plump and juicy you can see 
the raisins plumping up already and you don't want

to overcook the beans the PU sorry and you want to 
keep them crunchy and fresh so rice this has been

refrigerated so it's nice and easy to spread and 
also the key to fried rice is when you make the

right make sure you don't add too much water 
it doesn't even need to be a day old rice or

anything okay the sauce goes in we're almost there 
now we're just going to toss everything together

press any rice lumps with the back of your spatula 
that's how you get rid of them and I'm cranking

the heat now because I want the rice to dry out 
a little bit so the sauce isn't too wet and once

all the grains are coated like this you're done oh 
that's it there's a very particular way to plate

American fried rice and one of the things that 
you want to do is make sure your rice is shaped

in the perfect bowl shape some people put it in 
like a heart shape or star shaped bowl if you're

making it for kids it can be kind of fun Center 
it as best you can and flip it out so you want

to pack it quite tightly otherwise when you pull 
it out it collapses ah there you go that's so cute

okay now I'm going to deck my plate with some 
fresh vegetables or some tomatoes and that'll

really help sort of cut the grease because as you 
can see there's a lot of fried stuff on here now

the drumstick I'm going to go with the biggest 
one here the octopus wieners on the other side

oh you can do ham some people do ham how many 
do I want yeah let's go with five and then you

top the rice with a sunny-side up fried egg whoa 
look at that it's so cute oh my god I see this

and it just reminds me of childhood what a fun 
looking plate I love the moment you break the

egg yolk and you really need the yolk for this I 
find it adds a touch of creaminess to everything

mmm I'm gonna take the bite of the fried chicken 
goes together so well hmm the rice is a little

sweet a little tart from the ketchup and then 
that egg that's the creaminess of the egg really

sort of mellows it out and then you've got the 
salty crunchy tender juicy fried chicken and I

haven't even gotten to the hotdog so it's so 
good it's so much fun and just by looking at

it you know your kids are gonna love it you know 
you and the kids inside of you is gonna love it

and it's a little bit of a prep but it really 
goes quite quickly once you've got everything

put together so I hope you give this a try 
and when you do send me a photo on Facebook

Twitter or Instagram if you haven't subscribed 
to the show please do so right here I put out

wonderful recipes every week and I will see 
you next time for your next delicious Kylie
